short_description: Tag the documents based on the rules defined by user.
long_description: Tag the documents based on the rules defined by user. The rule definitions should be input by either ON clause or TaggingRules argument. The rule table should follow the schema: tablename(tagname varchar, definition varchar). Five text operators are supported: equal(columnname,str), contain(columnname,str,lower,upper), dist(columnname,str1,str2,lower,upper), dict(columnname,dictionaryname,lower,upper), and superdist(columnname,str1,str2,NW/NR/PARA/SENT,str3,NW/NR/PARA/SENT). These operators can be connected by logic operators: and, or, not.

input_tables.rDescription: The input table that contains the texts.
input_tables.description: The input table that contains the texts.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of text table columns to copy to the output table. Note: Do not use the name 'tag' for an accumulate_column, because the function uses that name for the output table column that contains the tags.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of text table columns to copy to the output table. Note: Do not use the name 'tag' for an accumulate_column, because the function uses that name for the output table column that contains the tags.

argument_clauses.name: TaggingRules
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the tag names and tagging rules. Use this argument if and only if you do not specify a rules table. For information about defining tagging rules, refer to “/Defining Tagging Rules”/
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the tag names and tagging rules. Use this argument if and only if you do not specify a rules table. For information about defining tagging rules, refer to “/Defining Tagging Rules”/

argument_clauses.name: InputLanguage
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the language of the input text:  'en': English (default),  'zh_cn': Simple Chinese,  'zh_tw': Traditional Chinese, If Tokenize specifies 'true', then the function uses the value of Language to create the word tokenizer.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the language of the input text:  'en': English (default),  'zh_cn': Simple Chinese,  'zh_tw': Traditional Chinese, If Tokenize specifies 'true', then the function uses the value of Language to create the word tokenizer.

argument_clauses.name: Tokenize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function tokenizes the input text before evaluating the rules and tokenizes the text string parameter in the rule definition when parsing a rule. If you specify 'true', then you must also specify the Language argument. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function tokenizes the input text before evaluating the rules and tokenizes the text string parameter in the rule definition when parsing a rule. If you specify 'true', then you must also specify the Language argument. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: OutputbyTag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function outputs a tuple when a text document matches multiple tags. The default value is 'false', which means that one tuple in the output stands for one document and the matched tags are listed in the output column tag.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function outputs a tuple when a text document matches multiple tags. The default value is 'false', which means that one tuple in the output stands for one document and the matched tags are listed in the output column tag.

argument_clauses.name: TagDelimiter
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the delimiter that separates multiple tags in the output column tag if outputby.tag has the value 'false' (the default). The default value is the comma (,). If outputby.tag has the value 'true', specifying this argument causes an error.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the delimiter that separates multiple tags in the output column tag if OutputByTag has the value 'false' (the default). The default value is the comma (,). If OutputByTag has the value 'true', specifying this argument causes an error.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
